name: halyard
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a rope or cable (= a metal rope) that is used to pull something such as a sail or flag up or down on a ship: Crew members hauled on the halyards. He released the main halyard and the sail came down. Compare
lanyard
More examplesFewer examplesShe walked by the marina, where the halyards jingled on the masts of the boats that were berthed there."Fly," he yelled and let the spinnaker halyard go.A new set of scarves and banners were being bent onto halyards ready for hoisting.The spar crashed down across the cabin top in a tangle of twisted stays and halyards.
